member.name: T:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents
member.summary: Holds events that allow performing of custom logic at specific points within the application's life cycle.

remarks.para: The events are represented by fields of the type. Handler methods need to be assigned to the Execute event of individual fields.
Some of the ApplicationEvents are not raised out of web-based applications without the CMSApplication module (when using the Kentico API externally).

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.PreInitialized
member.summary: Occurs after the application pre-initialization.
member.remarks: Fires only once during the application lifetime. Handlers need to be attached in the PreInit of modules.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.UpdateData
member.summary: Occurs when the application is ready to perform an upgrade routine.

remarks.para: This event is not intended to be used in custom code.
This event fires on every application start.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.Initialized
member.summary: Occurs after the application finishes initialization.

remarks.para: When this event occurs, the database connection is available and all modules are initialized.
Fires only once during the application lifetime. Handlers need to be attached in the PreInit or Init of modules.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.PostStart
member.summary: Occurs after the end of the first application request after successful initialization.

remarks.para: Fires only once during the application lifetime. Use to perform additional async tasks needed for application startup.
Response time can be affected by long running operations.
This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.End
member.summary: Occurs just before the application shuts down.

remarks.para: Fires only once during the application lifetime.
This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.
Do not use this event for performing critical actions. Code execution can be forcibly interrupted after a short period of time.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.Finalize
member.summary: Occurs just before the application shuts down, after the application event.

remarks.para: This event is not intended to be used in custom code. Use instead.
The purpose of the event is to call actions after custom code execution within the event.
Fires only once during the application lifetime.
This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.
Do not use this event for performing critical actions. Code execution can be forcibly interrupted after a short period of time.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.Error
member.summary: Occurs when an unhandled exception is thrown.
member.remarks: This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.SessionStart
member.summary: Occurs when a new HTTP session is created for a client.
member.remarks: This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.SessionEnd
member.summary: Occurs when an HTTP session is destroyed.

remarks.para: This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.
May not be raised if the application is configured to use a session state mode different than InProc.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.GetVaryByCustomString
member.summary: Occurs when the application evaluates variables in custom names of output cache keys.
member.remarks: This event only occurs for web-based applications. For example, does not occur when using the Kentico API in an external console application.

member.name: M:CMS.Base.ApplicationEvents.#ctor
member.summary: The class is not intended to be used as instance type. Static modifier is not used due to possibility of using extension methods.

member.name: T:CMS.Base.RequestEvents
member.summary: Holds events that allow performing of custom logic at specific points within the request processing.

remarks.para: These request events allow you to handle most usable events from application without the need to create a custom HTTP module or edit global.asax.
The events are represented by fields of the type. Handler methods need to be assigned to the Execute event of individual fields.
The events are not raised out of web-based applications without the CMSApplication module (when using the Kentico API externally).

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.Prepare
member.summary: Occurs before the event.
member.remarks: This event is related to the lifecycle only.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.Begin
member.summary: Occurs as the first event in the HTTP pipeline chain of execution when ASP.NET responds to a request.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.Authenticate
member.summary: Occurs when a security module has established the identity of a user.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostAuthenticate
member.summary: Occurs when a security module has established the identity of the user.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.Authorize
member.summary: Occurs when a security module has verified user authorization.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostAuthorize
member.summary: Occurs when the user for the current request has been authorized.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.ResolveRequestCache
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET finishes an authorization event to let the caching modules serve requests from the cache, bypassing execution of the event handler (for example, a page or an XML Web service).

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostResolveRequestCache
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET bypasses execution of the current event handler and allows a caching module to serve a request from the cache.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.MapRequestHandler
member.summary: Occurs when a handler is selected to respond to the request.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostMapRequestHandler
member.summary: Occurs after ASP.NET has mapped the current request to the appropriate event handler.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.AcquireRequestState
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET acquires the current state (for example, session state) that is associated with the current request.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostAcquireRequestState
member.summary: Occurs after the request state (for example, session state) that is associated with the current request has been obtained.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PreRequestHandlerExecute
member.summary: Occurs just before ASP.NET starts executing an event handler.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostRequestHandlerExecute
member.summary: Occurs when the ASP.NET event handler (for example, a page or an XML Web service) finishes execution.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.ReleaseRequestState
member.summary: Occurs after ASP.NET finishes executing all request event handlers. This event causes state modules to save the current state data

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostReleaseRequestState
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET has completed executing all request event handlers and the request state data has been stored.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.UpdateRequestCache
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET finishes executing an event handler in order to let caching modules store responses that will be used to serve subsequent requests from the cache.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostUpdateRequestCache
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET finishes updating caching modules and storing responses that are used to serve subsequent requests from the cache.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.LogRequest
member.summary: Occurs just before ASP.NET performs any logging for the current request.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PostLogRequest
member.summary: Occurs when ASP.NET has completed processing all the event handlers for the event.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.End
member.summary: Occurs as the last event in the HTTP pipeline chain of execution when ASP.NET responds to a request.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.RunEndRequestTasks
member.summary: Occurs after the event has finished.
member.remarks: Response time can be affected by long running operations.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.Finalize
member.summary: Occurs as the last event in the pipeline and can be used to clean up and release resources used by the request.
member.remarks: Response time can be affected by long running operations.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.RequestCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the managed objects that are associated with the request have been released.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PreSendRequestHeaders
member.summary: Occurs just before ASP.NET sends HTTP headers to the client.

member.name: F:CMS.Base.RequestEvents.PreSendRequestContent
member.summary: Occurs just before ASP.NET sends content to the client.

member.name: T:CMS.Base.SafeDictionary`2
member.summary: Represents a thread-safe collection of key/value pairs that can be modified by multiple threads concurrently.

remarks.para: Keep in mind that the operations of this class are thread-safe. However, a sequence of operations inherently cannot be thread-safe. If you want to perform multiple operations as one atomic operation, use the object.

In current implementation some read operations do not require locking (i.e. multiple threads can read even though some other thread has the lock). If your situation requires all the readers to wait when the dictionary is locked by some other thread, consider some other collection suitable for readers-writers synchronization problem.

member.summary: Default value.

member.summary: If true, the weak references are used for the items so the memory can be cleared upon request

member.summary: If true, the dictionary is copied (not cloned) to a new thread

member.summary: Object used for underlying Hashtable access synchronization.

member.name: P:CMS.Base.SafeDictionary`2.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Returns true if dictionary is synchronized.
member.remarks: Current implementation ensures thread-safety for read/write operations (read operations are safe to be performed without the need for locking). To synchronize enumeration or multiple operations use .

member.name: P:CMS.Base.SafeDictionary`2.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the .
member.returns: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

remarks.para: Utilize this property when you need to perform multiple dictionary operations as a single atomic operation, or when you need to enumerate the entries.
Obtaining a lock does not prevent all other threads from read operations, since most read operations do not need to use locking.

member.name: M:CMS.Base.CMSActionContext.DisableAll
member.summary:
Disables all automated actions except for the ones necessary to keep the system consistent
Disables: Logging for synchronization, event log, web farm tasks, versioning and cache dependencies Timestamp update Object invalidation Cache usage Asynchronous actions Sending of emails Smart search indexing Updating ratings
Does not disable: Object serialization

member.remarks: The derived classes must implement a parameterless constructor. The extender is a singleton, the same instance is used to attach behavior to multiple ojects. The process of attaching a behavior specifies a scope and excludes extenders with a scope that does not match. Two scopes are considered equal when the string values are equal. The comparison is case-insensitive.

member.name: T:CMS.Base.ContextContainer`1
member.summary: Container class for storing ambient context data. The container is backed by both the HTTP context items (if available) and an field so that the data are available along the asynchronous control flow in a web application.

remarks.para: To prevent the ambient context data from flowing along the asynchronous control flow or to child threads use the method.
The class prevents the ambient context data from implicitly flowing. Instead, the context data are explicitly cloned upon initializing the new thread.

member.name: T:CMS.Base.Routing.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute
member.summary: Represents a route to a Kentico HTTP handler using a route template that supports inline constraints.
member.remarks:
Route templates are compatible with ASP.NET MVC 5 route templates with the following exceptions:
Only guid and int inline constraints are supported, other constraints are ignored.
There must be no unpaired braces except the escaped ones, otherwise an exception is thrown.
Routes to Kentico HTTP handlers are excluded from URL generation, i.e. in MVC applications it is not possible to accidentally generate an URL to a Kentico HTTP handler instead of a controller action.

member.name: P:CMS.Base.Routing.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.MarkedType
member.summary: Gets the type of a Kentico HTTP handler.

member.name: P:CMS.Base.Routing.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.RouteTemplate
member.summary: Gets the route template.

member.name: P:CMS.Base.Routing.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the order weight of the route.
member.remarks: Routes are sorted for each HTTP handler in increasing order based on the order value. Routes without the order weight specified have an order value of 0. Negative values are valid and can be used to position a route before all non-negative routes.

member.name: P:CMS.Base.Routing.RegisterHttpHandlerAttribute.CMSMainApplicationOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets value representing if this route should be registered for main (administration) application only.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:CMS.Base.ThreadWorker`1.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the worker process.

remarks.para: Implement this method to specify what the worker must do in order to not lose its internal data when being finished.
Execution or completeness is not guaranteed. Do not use this method for time-consuming actions. Code execution can be forcibly interrupted after a short period of time.

The method is called in following scenarios:
Application is terminating and event is called.
Thread was aborted (for any reason).
method was called.

member.summary: Worker processing queue in single (one per application and generic variant), ever-running asynchronous thread

member.name: F:CMS.Base.ThreadQueueWorker`2.Events
member.summary: Events fired by the worker

summary.para: Indicates whether method can put items in queue for asynchronous processing. True by default. Work items are processed synchronously when set to false.
Unless explicitly set, the default implementation returns value of flag.

remarks.para: Setting this flag to false does not affect existing queue items.

Setting this flag to false can cause deadlocks as work items which would be queued and processed from synchronization context of one worker thread are processed synchronously from possibly multiple threads.
Setting this flag to false is recommended in context of tests only. It is not intended to be set to false in production environment.
